intro: Karpatiosorbus rhodanthera, commonly known as the Carpathian hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to the Carpathian Mountains in Central and Eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 2–4 meters and features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has pinnate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, red berries in the autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
